title: New Jersey's 7th congressional district
deleted: In the 2012 general election, Republican incumbent [[Leonard Lance]] held his seat against Democratic challenger [[Upendra J. Chivukula]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Salvador Rizzo, ''The Star-Ledger'' |title=N.J. 7th Congressional District winner: Leonard Lance |url=http://www.nj.com/politics/index.ssf/2012/11/nj_7th_congressional_district.html |access-date=February 8, 2018 |publisher=NJ.com |archive-date=December 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201229053846/https://www.nj.com/politics/2012/11/nj_7th_congressional_district.html |url-status=live }}</ref> In the 2010 general election, Democratic challenger Ed Potosnak challenged Lance, but Lance defeated Potosnak by a margin of 59% to 41%. For the 2012 election, both Potosnak and former Edison Mayor [[Jun Choi]] announced their candidacies for the Democratic nomination.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Archived copy |url=http://www.edpotosnak.com/press-releases/319-potosnak-files-2012-bid-for-us-congress-in-njs-7th-congressional-district.html |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110718103555/http://www.edpotosnak.com/press-releases/319-potosnak-files-2012-bid-for-us-congress-in-njs-7th-congressional-district.html |archive-date=July 18, 2011 |access-date=May 23, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Max Pizarro |date=May 5, 2011 |title=Choi announces 7th District Congressional candidacy | Observer |url=http://www.politickernj.com/47411/choi-announces-congressional-candidacy |access-date=February 8, 2018 |publisher=Politickernj.com |archive-date=December 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201229053845/https://observer.com/new-jersey-politics/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Choi dropped out of the race in December 2011 after redistricting left his Edison home outside the 7th District. Potosnak dropped out of the race in January 2012 to take a position as executive director of the New Jersey League of Conservation Voters, leaving a momentarily empty field for the Democratic nomination.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Max Pizarro |date=January 16, 2012 |title=Potosnak ends CD 7 run to take job as ED of League of Conservation Voters | Observer |url=http://www.politickernj.com/53944/potosnak-ends-cd-7-run-take-job-ed-league-conservation-voters |access-date=February 8, 2018 |publisher=Politickernj.com |archive-date=December 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201229053851/https://observer.com/new-jersey-politics/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

In 2008, [[Mike Ferguson (New Jersey)|Mike Ferguson]] (who had first been elected in 2000, replacing [[Bob Franks]]) did not seek another term. [[Linda Stender]] won the Democratic nomination unopposed, while Republican primary voters chose State Senator [[Leonard Lance]] in a field of eight candidates. In the [[New Jersey's 7th congressional district election, 2008| general election]], Lance defeated Assemblywoman Linda Stender by a margin of 25,833 votes.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Local and National Election Results - Election Center 2008 - Elections & Politics from CNN.com |work=CNN |url=http://www.cnn.com/ELECTION/2008/results/individual/#mapHNJ/H/07 |access-date=May 20, 2010 |archive-date=November 7, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081107105721/http://www.cnn.com/ELECTION/2008/results/individual/#mapHNJ/H/07 |url-status=live }}</ref>
